channel.title: 562 Cache Keeps Re-downloading
channel.description:
[s]Hello
I have set up my cache auto-downloader for my 562 server. It's been working fine for months, but here recently one day, it just decided to fail and I can't figure it out.
Every time I run my client, it tries and successfully downloads the cache, even if the user already has the client. Once the cache is re-downloaded, the client will run. Once the client is closed and re-opened it will download again and overwrite the cache.
Could this be a server related issue? Maybe an IP tables issue? I disabled it but it seems like more of a client issue. The thing is, I didn't change a thing with the cache or client. This has be scratching my head. I have noticed that this may be related to Java 7. JDK 7 also seems to cause issues on linux with the server so maybe it is the new java.
Any help would be greatly appreciated.
-Kizz[/s]
Disregard this, I have fixed the issue by altering the Version check file location to my server. Dumb me.

item.title: 562 Cache Keeps Re-downloading
item.dc:creator: @cdoggy cdoggy
item.description:
@cdoggy wrote:

[s]Hello

I have set up my cache auto-downloader for my 562 server. It’s been working fine for months, but here recently one day, it just decided to fail and I can’t figure it out.

Every time I run my client, it tries and successfully downloads the cache, even if the user already has the client. Once the cache is re-downloaded, the client will run. Once the client is closed and re-opened it will download again and overwrite the cache.

Could this be a server related issue? Maybe an IP tables issue? I disabled it but it seems like more of a client issue. The thing is, I didn’t change a thing with the cache or client. This has be scratching my head. I have noticed that this may be related to Java 7. JDK 7 also seems to cause issues on linux with the server so maybe it is the new java.

Any help would be greatly appreciated.
